title: Parmesan Fridge Storage Tips

items.name: Opened block (refrigerated)
items.details: Lasts about 4-6 weeks in the fridge when stored properly. Parmesan has low moisture content and is aged, making it more resistant to spoilage than softer cheeses.

items.name: Wrapping method
items.details: Wrap tightly in wax paper or parchment paper, then cover with plastic wrap or place in an airtight container.

items.name: Best fridge location
items.details: Store in the coldest part of the fridge, typically the back of the bottom shelf.

items.name: Mold handling
items.details: If you see mold, cut off about an inch around the affected area and the rest should still be fine.

items.name: Frozen grated Parmesan
items.details: Can be grated and frozen for up to 6 months without losing much flavor.

notes: Parmesan is one of the more resilient cheeses for storage due to its low moisture and aging process.
